noun.description: The use of radio for determining the position of something by means of reflected radio waves or transmitted signals, especially for the purpose of navigation or tracking; specifically (originally British, now historical) radar, as first developed for locating enemy ships and aircraft.
A position as determined by the detection of radio signals, especially in tracking wild animals.

origin: 1920s (in an earlier sense). Partly from radio + location, and partly from radio- + location.
